channel.title: Opinions/Inputs what you want to see?
channel.description:
Just curious as to what people want, enjoy and keep players sticking to a rsps? Before it was spawns and fast money/xp and about pking. What uniqueness do you want to see these day?
Just gathering ideas.
My Likings is a server that has cool minigames and has features to make you feel like you've gained something.
What's the idea of servers these days?

item.title: Opinions/Inputs what you want to see?
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.source: Opinions/Inputs what you want to see?

item.title: Opinions/Inputs what you want to see?
item.dc:creator: @CSharp95 CSharp95
item.description:
@CSharp95 wrote:

[quote=“Welliton_inc, post:7, topic:551175”][quote author=Skyro link=topic=670092.msg4480806#msg4480806 date=1429568269]
Just curious as to what people want, enjoy and keep players sticking to a rsps? What uniqueness do you want to see these day?
[/quote]
I like servers which is not some pre-eoc garbage. In all honesty, I don’t understand why so many people are creating 718 servers etc. That was the time when RuneScape was just complete trash. Everyone who played back in the day knows that RuneScape was at its best during the 2007 era. 474 onwards was a decline. Hence why more people play OSRS than RS3. I personally will never play a server 474 onwards. And no, I refuse to play a 317 loading higher revision graphic too…[/quote]
That’s because it was far more balanced. There weren’t melee weapons that could plow over someone in 2 special attacks. You had the tools for pretty much any situation, it was up to you how you used them. Then it got to the point where if you didn’t invest months into dungeoneering to get a rapier and 95 prayer then you might as well not even try.
That’s not just player killing either, that includes bosses. Trying to fight over Bandos with someone with a divine, rapier, bandos, soulsplit and a pack-yak whilst using a whip was just pissing in the wind.

Read full topic
item.source: Opinions/Inputs what you want to see?

item.title: Opinions/Inputs what you want to see?

item.description:
@Callisto wrote:

a 2004-2006 economy server (rune is considered good) which lasts more than a month. that’s all i wil play and there is nothing on the market

Just curious as to what people want, enjoy and keep players sticking to a rsps? What uniqueness do you want to see these day?

I like servers which is not some pre-eoc garbage. In all honesty, I don’t understand why so many people are creating 718 servers etc. That was the time when RuneScape was just complete trash. Everyone who played back in the day knows that RuneScape was at its best during the 2007 era. 474 onwards was a decline. Hence why more people play OSRS than RS3. I personally will never play a server 474 onwards. And no, I refuse to play a 317 loading higher revision graphic too…

item.title: Opinions/Inputs what you want to see?
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

WarTusk-RSPS:

I like slow XP and slow cash. So gold feels more valuable and so does your levels! And same with low drop rates I like working for my accomplishments but thats just me

item.title: Opinions/Inputs what you want to see?
item.dc:creator: @CSharp95 CSharp95
item.description:
@CSharp95 wrote:

Any part of the gameplay that’s actually representative of the game you’re trying to emulate helps quite a bit. I.E not catching sharks at a rate of 1 per half a second or not cutting gems into full amulets.

Read full topic
item.source: Opinions/Inputs what you want to see?

item.title: Opinions/Inputs what you want to see?
item.dc:creator: @stCky stCky
item.description:
@stCky wrote:

End game perks, not donator perks, not in-store perks, end game perks rewarded based on the achievement.

[ul][li]Oh you got 99 woodcutting? Along with the cape, while you wear it your chopping rate is increased 1.5![/li]

[li]
Oh, you’ve killed 30,000 people? Hey why don’t you earn this wicked skull emblem to show how badass you are - it also increases damage dealt against monsters 1.5![/li]
[li]Oh, you’ve spent over 48 hours logged in? Here’s a plane ticket to Guatemala![/li][/ul]

The point is the rewards are based on what you’ve accomplished and not what you’ve paid/bought

Read full topic
